entries.name: startQuest
entries.text: Good day, wanderer. I am Arwen.

children.name: arwenWho
children.text: Arwen! You know, from The Lord of the Rings. Elrond's daughter and all that!
children.response: Ummm... I have no idea what you're talking about.

children.name: myBad
children.text: My bad. Anyway, I'm looking for this clock and asking if anyone knows of anything about it.
children.response: Clock? I might know something. But I don't hand out stolen clock info for free.

children.name: howMuch
children.response: Well, it's my father. I haven't heard from him for years. I would give anything for some news on his well-being.

children.name: anything
children.response: Yes. As long as it's "can you tell me what you know about some clock."

children.name: okay
children.response: Thank you. The last I heard or saw of him, he was at the far south end of town, the last house by the sea.

children.name: youTried
children.response: Yes, but unfortunately this NPC mod does not allow me to move from this spot.

children.name: pushingIt
children.text: Come on! The name? The uncanny ressemblance? You're the real deal.
children.response: Please don't take this the wrong way, but: get out.

entries.name: elrondCompleted
entries.text: Thank you, thank you so much for finding my father.

children.name: aboutThatClock
children.text: I'm more than happy to help. Now...

children.name: theClock
children.text: The village clock? You said you would tell me about it if I talked to your father.
children.response: Oh, right! Well, it was last Saturday night. I was upstairs and about to go to bed when I heard the village bell ring, up on the north shore.

children.name: notNew
children.text: Yes, all the people are saying this. Do you have any Brand New Information?
children.response: Perhaps, because some minutes after the bell rang, there was a great deal of commotion outside my door. I went to investigate and I saw the most frightening-looking man.

children.name: notGood
children.response: Tell me about it. He was dressed in black from head to toe, dark as the night, but with piercing white eyes.

children.name: notGood2
children.response: I know, right? Anyway, he clearly held the village clock. He had two or three friends and they ran toward South Bridge and crossed it.

children.name: southBridge
children.response: Yes, just that way. You likely already passed it finding my father.

children.name: thatAll
children.response: No, just that I believe they turned north after crossing the bridge and headed up along the east shore road.

children.name: thanks
children.response: No, thank you. For finding my father. I'm forever grateful.

entries.name: elrondAccepted
entries.text: Have you found him yet? Just go to that house furthest south at land's end.

entries.name: clockCompleted
entries.text: We owe you a great debt for all your labors!
